summary: William D. Campbell was an FBI Special Agent. The documents indicate that he was interviewed by the Senate Select Committee (SSC) regarding FBI investigations, specifically those related to Martin Luther King Jr. and electronic surveillance activities. The documents also reference the FBI's response to requests from the U.S. Senate Select Committee on Intelligence Activities (SSC) for materials related to Martin Luther King, Jr., and the Southern Christian Leadership Conference.
significance: Based on the provided documents, William D. Campbell's significance lies in his involvement with FBI investigations related to Martin Luther King Jr. and electronic surveillance, and his subsequent interview by the Senate Select Committee. The documents do not directly link him to the JFK assassination, but rather to investigations and inquiries surrounding other significant figures and events of the time.
